trans-unit.source: Dynamic Encryption: Configure Content Key Authorization Policy using .NET
trans-unit.target: Dynamic Encryption: Configure Content Key Authorization Policy using .NET

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure an authorization policy for a content key.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure an authorization policy for a content key.

trans-unit.source: Dynamic Encryption: Configure Content Key Authorization Policy
trans-unit.target: Dynamic Encryption: Configure Content Key Authorization Policy

trans-unit.source: Overivew
trans-unit.target: Overivew

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Media Services enables you to deliver your content dynamically encrypted with Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) (using 128-bit encryption keys) and/or PlayReady DRM.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Media Services enables you to deliver your content dynamically encrypted with Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) (using 128-bit encryption keys) and/or PlayReady DRM.

trans-unit.source: Media Services also provides a service for delivering keys and PlayReady licenses to authorized clients.
trans-unit.target: Media Services also provides a service for delivering keys and PlayReady licenses to authorized clients.

trans-unit.source: Currently, you can encrypt the following streaming formats: HLS, MPEG DASH, and Smooth Streaming.
trans-unit.target: Currently, you can encrypt the following streaming formats: HLS, MPEG DASH, and Smooth Streaming.

trans-unit.source: You cannot encrypt HDS streaming format, or progressive downloads.
trans-unit.target: You cannot encrypt HDS streaming format, or progressive downloads.

trans-unit.source: If you want for Media Services to encrypt an asset, you need to associate an encryption key (**CommonEncryption** or **EnvelopeEncryption**) with the asset (as described [here](media-services-dotnet-create-contentkey.md)) and also configure authorization policies for the key (as described in this article).
trans-unit.target: If you want for Media Services to encrypt an asset, you need to associate an encryption key (**CommonEncryption** or **EnvelopeEncryption**) with the asset (as described [here](media-services-dotnet-create-contentkey.md)) and also configure authorization policies for the key (as described in this article).

trans-unit.source: When a stream is requested by a player, Media Services uses the specified key to dynamically encrypt your content using AES or PlayReady encryption.
trans-unit.target: When a stream is requested by a player, Media Services uses the specified key to dynamically encrypt your content using AES or PlayReady encryption.

trans-unit.source: To decrypt the stream, the player will request the key from the key delivery service.
trans-unit.target: To decrypt the stream, the player will request the key from the key delivery service.

trans-unit.source: To decide whether or not the user is authorized to get the key, the service evaluates the authorization policies that you specified for the key.
trans-unit.target: To decide whether or not the user is authorized to get the key, the service evaluates the authorization policies that you specified for the key.

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports multiple ways of authenticating users who make key requests.
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports multiple ways of authenticating users who make key requests.

trans-unit.source: The content key authorization policy could have one or more authorization restrictions: **open**, **token** restriction, or **IP** restriction.
trans-unit.target: The content key authorization policy could have one or more authorization restrictions: **open**, **token** restriction, or **IP** restriction.

trans-unit.source: The token restricted policy must be accompanied by a token issued by a Secure Token Service (STS).
trans-unit.target: The token restricted policy must be accompanied by a token issued by a Secure Token Service (STS).

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports tokens in the **Simple Web Tokens** ([SWT](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg185950.aspx#BKMK_2)) format and **JSON Web Token **(JWT) format.
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports tokens in the **Simple Web Tokens** ([SWT](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg185950.aspx#BKMK_2)) format and **JSON Web Token **(JWT) format.

trans-unit.source: Media Services does not provide Secure Token Services.
trans-unit.target: Media Services does not provide Secure Token Services.

trans-unit.source: You can create a custom STS or leverage Microsoft Azure ACS to issue tokens.
trans-unit.target: You can create a custom STS or leverage Microsoft Azure ACS to issue tokens.

trans-unit.source: The STS must be configured to create a token signed with the specified key and issue claims that you specified in the token restriction configuration (as described in this article).
trans-unit.target: The STS must be configured to create a token signed with the specified key and issue claims that you specified in the token restriction configuration (as described in this article).

trans-unit.source: The Media Services key delivery service will return the encryption key to the client if the token is valid and the claims in the token match those configured for the content key.
trans-unit.target: The Media Services key delivery service will return the encryption key to the client if the token is valid and the claims in the token match those configured for the content key.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see
trans-unit.target: For more information, see

trans-unit.source: JWT token authenitcation
trans-unit.target: JWT token authenitcation

trans-unit.source: [Integrate Azure Media Services OWIN MVC based app with Azure Active Directory and restrict content key delivery based on JWT claims](http://www.gtrifonov.com/2015/01/24/mvc-owin-azure-media-services-ad-integration/).
trans-unit.target: [Integrate Azure Media Services OWIN MVC based app with Azure Active Directory and restrict content key delivery based on JWT claims](http://www.gtrifonov.com/2015/01/24/mvc-owin-azure-media-services-ad-integration/).

trans-unit.source: [Use Azure ACS to issue tokens](http://mingfeiy.com/acs-with-key-services).
trans-unit.target: [Use Azure ACS to issue tokens](http://mingfeiy.com/acs-with-key-services).

trans-unit.source: Some considerations apply:
trans-unit.target: Some considerations apply:

trans-unit.source: To be able to use dynamic packaging and dynamic encryption, you must make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit.
trans-unit.target: To be able to use dynamic packaging and dynamic encryption, you must make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Scale a Media Service](media-services-manage-origins.md#scale_streaming_endpoints).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Scale a Media Service](media-services-manage-origins.md#scale_streaming_endpoints).

trans-unit.source: Your asset must contain a set of adaptive bitrate MP4s or adaptive bitrate Smooth Streaming files.
trans-unit.target: Your asset must contain a set of adaptive bitrate MP4s or adaptive bitrate Smooth Streaming files.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Encode an asset](media-services-encode-asset.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Encode an asset](media-services-encode-asset.md).

trans-unit.source: Upload and encode your assets using **AssetCreationOptions.StorageEncrypted** option.
trans-unit.target: Upload and encode your assets using **AssetCreationOptions.StorageEncrypted** option.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to have multiple content keys that require the same policy configuration, it is strongly recommended to create a single authorization policy and reuse it with multiple content keys.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to have multiple content keys that require the same policy configuration, it is strongly recommended to create a single authorization policy and reuse it with multiple content keys.

trans-unit.source: The Key Delivery service caches ContentKeyAuthorizationPolicy and its related objects (policy options and restrictions) for 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: The Key Delivery service caches ContentKeyAuthorizationPolicy and its related objects (policy options and restrictions) for 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: If you create a ContentKeyAuthorizationPolicy and specify to use a “Token” restriction, then test it, and then update the policy to “Open” restriction, it will take roughly 15 minutes before the policy switches to the “Open” version of the policy.
trans-unit.target: If you create a ContentKeyAuthorizationPolicy and specify to use a “Token” restriction, then test it, and then update the policy to “Open” restriction, it will take roughly 15 minutes before the policy switches to the “Open” version of the policy.

trans-unit.source: If you add or update your asset’s delivery policy, you must delete an existing locator (if any) and create a new locator.
trans-unit.target: If you add or update your asset’s delivery policy, you must delete an existing locator (if any) and create a new locator.

trans-unit.source: AES-128 Dynamic Encryption
trans-unit.target: AES-128 Dynamic Encryption

trans-unit.source: Open Restriction
trans-unit.target: Open Restriction

trans-unit.source: Open restriction means the system will deliver the key to anyone who makes a key request.
trans-unit.target: Open restriction means the system will deliver the key to anyone who makes a key request.

trans-unit.source: This restriction might be useful for testing purposes.
trans-unit.target: This restriction might be useful for testing purposes.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates an open authorization policy and adds it to the content key.
trans-unit.target: The following example creates an open authorization policy and adds it to the content key.

trans-unit.source: Token Restriction
trans-unit.target: Token Restriction

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to create a content key authorization policy and associate it with the content key.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to create a content key authorization policy and associate it with the content key.

trans-unit.source: The authorization policy describes what authorization requirements must be met to determine if the user is authorized to receive the key (for example, does the “verification key” list contain the key that the token was signed with).
trans-unit.target: The authorization policy describes what authorization requirements must be met to determine if the user is authorized to receive the key (for example, does the “verification key” list contain the key that the token was signed with).

trans-unit.source: To configure the token restriction option, you need to use an XML to describe the token’s authorization requirements.
trans-unit.target: To configure the token restriction option, you need to use an XML to describe the token’s authorization requirements.

trans-unit.source: The token restriction configuration XML must conform to the following XML schema.
trans-unit.target: The token restriction configuration XML must conform to the following XML schema.

trans-unit.source: Token restriction schema
trans-unit.target: Token restriction schema

trans-unit.source: When configuring the **token** restricted policy, you must specify the primary** verification key**, **issuer** and **audience** parameters.
trans-unit.target: When configuring the **token** restricted policy, you must specify the primary** verification key**, **issuer** and **audience** parameters.

trans-unit.source: The **primary verification key **contains the key that the token was signed with, **issuer** is the secure token service that issues the token.
trans-unit.target: The **primary verification key **contains the key that the token was signed with, **issuer** is the secure token service that issues the token.

trans-unit.source: The **audience** (sometimes called **scope**) describes the intent of the token or the resource the token authorizes access to.
trans-unit.target: The **audience** (sometimes called **scope**) describes the intent of the token or the resource the token authorizes access to.

trans-unit.source: The Media Services key delivery service validates that these values in the token match the values in the template.
trans-unit.target: The Media Services key delivery service validates that these values in the token match the values in the template.

trans-unit.source: When using **Media Services SDK for .NET**, you can use the **TokenRestrictionTemplate** class to generate the restriction token.
trans-unit.target: When using **Media Services SDK for .NET**, you can use the **TokenRestrictionTemplate** class to generate the restriction token.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates an authorization policy with a token restriction.
trans-unit.target: The following example creates an authorization policy with a token restriction.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the client would have to present a token that contains: signing key (VerificationKey), a token issuer, and required claims.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the client would have to present a token that contains: signing key (VerificationKey), a token issuer, and required claims.

trans-unit.source: Test token
trans-unit.target: Test token

trans-unit.source: To get a test token based on the token restriction that was used for the key authorization policy, do the following.
trans-unit.target: To get a test token based on the token restriction that was used for the key authorization policy, do the following.

trans-unit.source: PlayReady Dynamic Encryption
trans-unit.target: PlayReady Dynamic Encryption

trans-unit.source: Media Services enables you to configure the rights and restrictions that you want for the PlayReady DRM runtime to enforce when a user is trying to play back protected content.
trans-unit.target: Media Services enables you to configure the rights and restrictions that you want for the PlayReady DRM runtime to enforce when a user is trying to play back protected content.

trans-unit.source: When protecting your content with PlayReady, one of the things you need to specify in your authorization policy is an XML string that defines the [PlayReady license template](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783459.aspx).
trans-unit.target: When protecting your content with PlayReady, one of the things you need to specify in your authorization policy is an XML string that defines the [PlayReady license template](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783459.aspx).

trans-unit.source: In Media Services SDK for .NET, the **PlayReadyLicenseResponseTemplate** and **PlayReadyLicenseTemplate** classes will help you define the PlayReady License Template.
trans-unit.target: In Media Services SDK for .NET, the **PlayReadyLicenseResponseTemplate** and **PlayReadyLicenseTemplate** classes will help you define the PlayReady License Template.

trans-unit.source: Open Restriction
trans-unit.target: Open Restriction

trans-unit.source: Open restriction means the system will deliver the key to anyone who makes a key request.
trans-unit.target: Open restriction means the system will deliver the key to anyone who makes a key request.

trans-unit.source: This restriction might be useful for testing purposes.
trans-unit.target: This restriction might be useful for testing purposes.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates an open authorization policy and adds it to the content key.
trans-unit.target: The following example creates an open authorization policy and adds it to the content key.

trans-unit.source: Token Restriction
trans-unit.target: Token Restriction

trans-unit.source: To configure the token restriction option, you need to use an XML to describe the token’s authorization requirements.
trans-unit.target: To configure the token restriction option, you need to use an XML to describe the token’s authorization requirements.

trans-unit.source: The token restriction configuration XML must conform to the XML schema shown in [this](#schema) section.
trans-unit.target: The token restriction configuration XML must conform to the XML schema shown in [this](#schema) section.

trans-unit.source: To get a test token based on the token restriction that was used for the key authorization policy see [this](#test) section.
trans-unit.target: To get a test token based on the token restriction that was used for the key authorization policy see [this](#test) section.

trans-unit.source: Types used when defining ContentKeyAuthorizationPolicy
trans-unit.target: Types used when defining ContentKeyAuthorizationPolicy

trans-unit.source: ContentKeyRestrictionType
trans-unit.target: ContentKeyRestrictionType

trans-unit.source: public enum ContentKeyRestrictionType
trans-unit.target: public enum ContentKeyRestrictionType

trans-unit.source: Open = 0,
trans-unit.target: Open = 0,

trans-unit.source: TokenRestricted = 1,
trans-unit.target: TokenRestricted = 1,

trans-unit.source: IPRestricted = 2,
trans-unit.target: IPRestricted = 2,

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.target: Now that you have configured content key's authorization policy, go to the [How to configure asset delivery policy](media-services-dotnet-configure-asset-delivery-policy.md) topic.
